ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4 in one week
1 during the week it was due
in total this course took me 6 hours to cmplete
1 hour in total
1 hour
3 hrs
I did not spend much time on this seminar. Only a few hours to complete the assignment.
This took me 1 hour to complete.
1 hour
only one assignment required 5 hours.
0. just submitted form.
None
2 hours
Zero.
2 hours for the entire semester
n/a
2 hours spent going through the online process just once.
We had one online module to complete, which maybe took an hour or so.
2 at the most
2 hours total

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: not a course.
We only had to complete an online training and upload it online. We didn't have an instructor, nor any feedback on anything.
Didn't see a purpose in this course.
These trainings are important to our research as students and professionally.
Strength: Professor is qualified and knowledgeable Weakness: I cannot understand the Professor because of his accent. The SAS is taught absolutely poorly.
Overly simplistic and kind of a joke. If the university is serious about research ethics, it should devote more time to it than just assigning a 20 minute online course.
ONline 1hr reading followed by test. not much to evaluate
All that needed to be done for this course was to submit proof you had taken a training. I am not really sure how this qualifies as a course.
This course is not relevant to the management concentration who does not do research or a thesis.
I don't understand what taking that module was supposed to do. I read the first few pages then just skipped to the test and made educated guesses and passed.
It's alright. Important information to know and have, but I don't know how much of it I retained.
The purpose of this seminar is unclear. No evident structure, poor communication with the facilitator.
helpful

Not sure why we needed to register for a separate course to do this. It would make much more sense to include this as a required aspect of a course taken by everyone at YSPH (like Epi I or Biostats I). Not to mention, the fact that we did not know when the module was due until four days ahead of time. Thankfully I had already completed it for another class, but had I not it would have been an extreme inconvenience.

this course could have been improved by making us take an actual ethics course//have us read papers/scenarios/discuss ethical topics and issues in research. it is absurd that this is our only ethics course and that we could "exempt" by just submitting official ethical training.

I am not sure how to rate this course... I think it would be great to provide it before the beginning of the spring semester (like during the Winter Break) so that we may have the information before beginning our own research planning.

Is this a course? I feel like it was just a request to complete an online training and upload the certificate... These topics are of high importance. I think it would be interesting to require the online training and then do a structured lunch seminar with faculty members where faculty members discuss ethical issues in research with students from their department. This way students have the opportunity to discuss questions, issues, or the reality of ethics that might not be fully attainable when reading information online.
I learnt only a little and feel like this course should have taken the format of a workshop instead with a possibility for interaction and questions about real-field life examples
Good.
More communication is needed about this requirement. Most people did not know when it was due and what was involved until very late in the game.
boring but necessary
This was a rather pointless seminar, and I do not think it is necessary.
The module was quick and seemed more like busy work than anything else. I'm not sure what I should've gotten from it.

I thought this was a good research ethics online class to take. I wish it was instead a one-day event in which students were in attendance instead of having to complete the training over the computer. I know some students didn't really pay attention to the material and instead was just skimming, trying to find the answers to complete the training. It would be better to have this be a one-day, 2-hour event in which there were relevant lectures.
Using the online study tool to "teach" a course in ethics might not be appropriate - many topics are worth discussion and revision.

It's a bit frustrating to have something like ethics reduced to one 20-minute session that nobody really cares about or seems to want to engage in. There must be a more interesting way to present this information than through a tedious online format.
Very simple. Finished in under an hour.
I had already done all the required training for this course as part of my on campus job so it required no additional work for me.
It only involved completing online training. Not much to assess.
Was this a course? I just had to submit my IRB certificate. Not sure the point of it.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  There was no communication about this requirement until the day before it was due and the communication was not done by the "instructor". Luckily all it required was doing the training that pretty much every student already had to do as part of work or another class.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  Not enough information to evaluate the instructor
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  We never had a class for this course, and we never met the instructor.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  He wasn't involve except for sending out the assignment
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  I never met the instructor for this course because the requirements were completed online, outside of classroom.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  Never met him or interacted with him. Just received email to submit requirement.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  I never met this instructor.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  Great instructor, and genuinely cares about his students.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  I did not have any contact with the professor. He posted instructions on how to submit materials on the website and one announcement at the start of the semester.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  I love Kaveh and would love for him to teach me about this subject instead of taking an online module.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  I don't know who this person is.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  good
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  Good.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  Little interaction for this class but I appreciate the support he provides to students when there is need.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  Kaveh is lovely - this class however, was online, and required no involvement from him.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  I did not receive any feedback from this instructor.
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  No interactions with course instructor
Instructor: Kaveh Khoshnood  I don't know who this person is.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's simply a required course
Nobody understands what this course was about, besides doing a training course online.
Not sure what the purpose is for this class. Would be better applied in a class rather than just randomly doing it. Do the Yale one- it is easy and quick to get through.
Don't take it if you don't have to.
Required seminar.
This is not really a course.
This is a required course, but very easy to complete, as it is simply uploading proof of a training that the vast majority of students had already taken.
I just don't understand what it was supposed to be.
It's required to complete, especially important to those who will write a thesis for their degree. Still applicable to HPM and HCM students.
helpful
it isnt really a course, but needs to be improved.
Good.
modules online; not an official class
Online training session, just get it done. It is not fun but important.
It's a requirement for conducting YSPH research. Take it.

This seminar might be useful for students who have had zero encounter with research and understand nothing about the ethics behind it, but we learn about IRB and HSC in our classes and I think that is enough.

I had already taken an online training module for a different class so I found the material to be a review. However, I do believe it's important that students have a good understanding of research ethics before they dive into their own research.
Necessary, but not exactly useful.
I think it is reasonable to expect all YSPH students to take this course.
I don't know the purpose of the course and had no reminders or instruction as to what needed to be completed.
